intro: Macaranga crassistipulosa, commonly known as the broad-leafed macaranga, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in catkin-like inflorescences. It is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. Its rapid growth and ability to thrive in disturbed habitats make it an important pioneer species in ecological succession.
